byline.contributor: Patrick McGeehan and Jesse McKinley contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A fire at the Indian Point nuclear plant, about 24 miles north of New York City, was extinguished Saturday night, but the materials used to fight it could prove hazardous if they seep into the Hudson River.

headline.print_headline: Transformer Burns at Indian Point Reactor; Cuomo Cites Environmental Risks
headline.main: Transformer Burns at Indian Point; Cuomo Cites Potential Environmental Risks

snippet: A fire at the Indian Point nuclear plant, about 24 miles north of New York City, was extinguished Saturday night, but the materials used to fight it could prove hazardous if they seep into the Hudson River.
abstract: Firefighters douse transformer fire at Indian Point nuclear power plant in Buchanan, NY, with flame-retardant foam, raising concerns about foam's impact on environment.
